        Builds a multipart/form-data encoded byte array of the specified parameters (This method includes the end boundary by default).
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException
        See Also:
        buildMultipartFormData(Map, String, String, boolean)

      • buildMultipartFormData

        public static byte[] buildMultipartFormData(Map<String,Object> parameters,
                                            String boundary,
                                            String encoding,
                                            boolean includeEndBoundary)
                                     throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Builds a multipart/form-data encoded byte array of the specified parameters, that complies to RFC 1867. Note that the request sent to the server should have a header of the following form set: Content-type: multipart/form-data, boundary=boundary-parameter. E.g.: 
         HttpURLConnection connection = (HttpURLConnection)url.openConnection();
 connection.setRequestProperty("Content-type", "multipart/form-data, boundary=AaB03x");
        Parameters:
        parameters - A map of String keys to values that are either FileParts, in which case its contents will be uploaded; byte arrays, which will be uploaded as-is; or any other Object, in which case the value of the object's toString() method will be used.
        boundary - A boundary to use as separator between the encoded parts of the data.
        encoding - The character encoding for the data, e.g. "UTF-8".
        includeEndBoundary - Whether or not to include the end boundary
        Returns:
        A byte array in multipart/form-data format.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException

      • buildQueryString

        public static String buildQueryString(Map<String,Object> keyValuePairs)
        Builds a query string from the provided key-value-pairs. All spaces are substituted by '+' characters, and all non US-ASCII characters are escaped to hexadecimal notation (%xx).

      • setAcceptGZIPEncoding

        public static void setAcceptGZIPEncoding(URLConnection conn)
        Sets a request property on the supplied connection indicating that a server can respond with gzip-encoded data if it wants to.
        See Also:
        getInputStream(java.net.URLConnection)

      • getInputStream

        public static InputStream getInputStream(URLConnection conn)
                                  throws IOException
        Gets the InputStream for reading the response from a server. This method handles any encoding-related decoding of the data, e.g. gzip.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        setAcceptGZIPEncoding(java.net.URLConnection)
